channel.title: Uncategorized on The Outsider's Journey
channel.description: Recent content in Uncategorized on The Outsider's Journey

item.title: LOG 4.5: Hello Germany, From Bangalore
item.description: 9th May 2014 My dear friends, I said Iâ€™d write, so here I am ðŸ™‚ My thoughts and dreams wander back to you all often. I have been away from Oldenburg for longer than a month before for holidays but this time, even when it had only been two weeks, it felt like longer.

item.title: Recognising intelligent life on Earth
item.description: Recognising intelligent life on Earth Looks like humans are finally understanding how to recognise intelligence in life forms apart from themselves. I hope we will start to expand our definition enough to include many more species and understand our true place in the ecosystem.

item.title: Jaydei is now Janinthesky
item.description: After some consideration, I decided to change the name of the url to match my online name: Janinthesky.

item.title: The storm
item.description: It is an odd sort of night nearing summer solstice. Outside, everything lights up in flashes as bright as day as the magnificent branches of lightning strike further and further away.

item.title: Old and New Economy
item.description: http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=f0xRkaJCs5g#! All wealth comes from human contribution and nature. Hereâ€™s an interesting documentary about how money works and alternate systems that may work better.

item.title: I found a lost poem written onÂ 29th March
item.description: I found a lost poem written onÂ 29th March 2012 Â _grey clouds have blocked out the blue sky the air is cold and stillnot a soundÂ sensations are numb

item.title: Tum Itna Jo Muskura Rahe Ho: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: Continuing with the Jagjit Singh mood this autumn, here is another of his classics. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PSQ2SDlNRdI&feature=BFa **Tum Itna Jo Muskura Rahe Ho Kya Gham Hai Jisko Chhupa Rahe Ho**

item.title: That Morning
item.description: Turn the page, he said. She did and began reading. It spoke of warm sunshine pouring through the leaves in the morning and waking to the smell of coffee.

item.title: Home is where the Heart is
item.description: Most humans tend to want a place to belong to. A place to call oneâ€™s own where they plan to settle down and possibly spend the rest of their lives.

item.title: A day out at the North Sea
Beauty
item.description: There is beauty in nature â€“ stars, rain, flowers, trees swaying gently in the breeze â€“ and there is beauty in people. If one is in a certain kind of good mood, every face has a beauty shining from within; something that reflects in their eyes or smile.
